column4: Can you help a newbie to choose between Wine/VirtualBox/KVM/Other software in order to run Windows under Ubuntu? I don't know which one is best...
you are probably right, but why is virtualbox better?
virtualbox and other virtual machines have the same common ground but has pros and cons
yah keep learning new things EVERYDAY
sure I do, especially now since I installed Ubuntu yesterday (and haven't used Linux before)
hey your like me am a newbie too but this channel has given more knowledge by asking and asking the guys never wears-out in answering my sometimes nonsense newbie questions
sounds great that there are many nice people in here :)
they this why it excist to help the needy specialy us the newbies
sounds good. I've installed Ubuntu once, but don't think there was a step in the wizard where I could create a Ubuntu partition. Do I need to create it in advance of the installation?
try to check also your ram..if your gonna run the xp virtually well it eats a lot of resources
you can install virtualbox with the command line and everything but then the wierdest part is why have i going to run as root just to launch virtualbox. the answer is #vbox

you can ask whatever in that station if you hav problems on virtualbox
well if ever you start installing the virtualbox read sharply every instructions and never miss a thing....
